metadata.name: Malicious Usage Of IMDS Credentials Outside Of AWS Infrastructure
metadata.comment: Detects when an instance identity has taken an action that isn't inside SSM. This can indicate that a compromised EC2 instance is being used as a pivot point.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM user_access WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (actor.user.uid rlike '.\+:assumed-role/aws:.\+' AND NOT (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('ssm.amazonaws.com') AND lower(api.operation) = lower('registermanagedinstance') AND lower(src_endpoint.ip) = lower('aws internal')))

output.summary: Detects when an instance identity has taken an action that isn't inside SSM. This can indicate that a compromised EC2 instance is being used as a pivot point.

metadata.objective: False positive: A team has configured an EC2 instance to use instance profiles that grant the option for the EC2 instance to talk to other AWS Services References: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-instance-identity-roles.html, https://ermetic.com/blog/aws/aws-ec2-imds-what-you-need-to-know/, https://www.packetmischief.ca/2023/07/31/amazon-ec2-credential-exfiltration-how-it-happens-and-how-to-mitigate-it/#lifting-credentials-from-imds-this-is-why-we-cant-have-nice-things
